entry.def: The peel of a fruit such as a lemon or an apple is its skin.
When you peel fruit or vegetables, you remove their skins.

example.ex: She sat down in the kitchen and began peeling potatoes.
example.tran: 她坐在厨房里，开始削土豆皮。

entry.def: If you peel off something that has been sticking to a surface or if it peels off, it comes away from the surface.

example.ex: One of the kids was peeling plaster off the wall...
example.tran: 其中一个孩子在剥墙上的灰泥。

example.ex: It took me two days to peel off the labels...
example.tran: 我花了两天时间才揭下这些标签。

entry.def: If a surface is peeling, the paint on it is coming away.

example.ex: Its once-elegant white pillars are peeling.
example.tran: 曾经典雅的白色立柱正在掉漆。

entry.def: If you are peeling or if your skin is peeling, small pieces of skin are coming off, usually because you have been burned by the sun.

example.ex: His face, at the moment, was peeling from sunburn.
example.tran: 那时他的脸因为晒伤而脱皮。

means.word_mean: 1. loss of bits of outer skin by peeling or shedding or coming off in scales
1. having the paint loose and peeling away;
